course_title: Heaven and Earth: Renaissance Art and Culture in Northern Europe

sections.comments: ARTH 323 001 will be delivered 100% online and asynchronously.Painting, sculpture, and graphic art in France, the Netherlands, Germany, and England in the 15th and 16th centuries are studied, with special emphasis on the major figures of this period, from van Eyck and van der Weyden to Grunewald, Bosch, Durer, Holbein, and Bruegel. Topics include the transformation of craft into art as a self-reflective and intellectual practice (Kunst); the emergence of oil painting as a transformative medium; the German sculpted altarpiece and the triptych as Northern genres; visual art and the Reformation; the emergence of graphic culture and the fine art print; witchcraft and mystical nature in German art; classicism in the north; and the birth of secular art, portraiture, landscape, and scenes of everyday life.
ARTH 323 01W is a waitlist for ARTH 323 001. Students will be moved from the waitlist into the lecture as seats become available, and then notified of their registration via email.

description: Early Modern painting, sculpture, and the graphic arts from the great devotional triptychs, through the Reformation, to the emergence of a secular art (1400-1600).
